title: refactor(zome-call): optimize cap grant verification
body:
### Summary
- simplify (and hence optimize?) cap grant verification logic during a zome call, in case of remote agent calls
- cap grants behave more predictably now. Previously any cap grant that would authorize the zome call was looked up, irrespective of provided cap secret. If a zome was called with a cap secret and the corresponding cap grant was invalid, but there was another valid cap grant, the call was authorized. Now the cap grant is looked up by provided cap secret and doesn't take into account other possibly existing grants.
- cover more test cases
  - validate cap grant for non-granted function
  - validate cap grant for non-assigned agent
  - validate unrestricted grant
  - validate deleted unrestricted grant

### TODO:
- [x] CHANGELOG(s) updated with appropriate info
- [ ] Just before pressing the merge button, ensure new entries to CHANGELOG(s) are still under the _UNRELEASED_ heading

title: Fix clone cell idempotency for enable/disable
body:
### Summary

Enabling a clone cell that's already enabled or disabling a clone cell that's already disabled would previously return a `CloneCellNotFound` error. Now, in those cases, nothing happens and a successful result is returned.

title: Differentate between CellMissing and CellDisabled, and other fixes
body:
### Summary

`cell_by_id`, when a running cell can't be found, now checks the state to see if the cell is unavailable because it's disabled, or is just a totally invalid cell id

Also a small fix that might be helpful: when initializing the scheduler, only ephemeral functions for currently running cells were cleared out, which could cause cells started later to have old ephemeral cruft. Now all ephemeral functions are cleared from all spaces on scheduler init @thedavidmeister

Also some renames, which led me to develop a theory for why our apps sometimes fail to restart, a truly marvelous theory which the margin of this PR is too narrow to contain

### TODO:
- [ ] CHANGELOG(s) updated with appropriate info
- [ ] Just before pressing the merge button, ensure new entries to CHANGELOG(s) are still under the _UNRELEASED_ heading

title: Tracing Fixes
body:
- adds a `tracing_override` conductor config so i can specify a real RUST_LOG string through launcher which right now only allows single word filters.
- adds filenames and line numbers to tracing output so i can find where errors are generated from
- forks "observability" crate into "holochain_tracing" in the monorepo so we can manage dependencies and make updates (observability is owned by tom)
- updates dependencies of new holochain_tracing crate -- but not opentelemetry for now, because it was a difficult upgrade and we don't really use it.

title: Add diagnostic testing crates
body:
### Summary

Replaces #1774.

This PR is entirely about adding two new crates unrelated to any crates we already have. So this PR is about getting generally familiar with it if desired, but also feedback on if we want this to be outside of our normal build and testing, etc.

This embodies the work I did several months ago to create a TUI for diagnosing gossip issues. Creates `holochain_diagnostics` crate which can be our repository for diagnostic testing tooling and patterns. Actual diagnostic tests live in a separate crate `diagnostic_tests`. Devs can create their own diagnostic tests locally using `holochain_diagnostics`, and if they have a good one that seems worth sharing, they can put it in `diagnostic_tests`.

It's expected that diagnostic tests are largely built for the purpose of examining some specific behavior and may not often be reused, but we hope to reuse as much as possible of the patterns or actual tests.

You can run this diagnostic test with `cargo run --release --example link_storm`

### TODO:
